result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony James Lemieux was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, including 14CF005557, with credit for -0- days time served.  
The Court found that the defendant is indigent and waived all costs and surcharges including the DNA surcharge and the DV surcharge.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence and count 1, including 14CF005557, with credit for -0- days time served.  
The Court found that the defendant is indigent and waived all costs and surcharges including the DNA surcharge and the DV surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony James Lemieux

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (21 pages) SENTENCING commencing SEPTEMBER 1, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Anthony James Lemieux in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Anthony James Lemieux in custody. Nick Heitman  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab  
Victim notified, sentencing proceeded.
Parties clarified the maximum penalties on the record.
  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant.
As to count 1:

  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 10 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, including 14CF005557,  with credit for -0- days time served.  

As to count 2:

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence and count 1, including 14CF005557,  with credit for -0- days time served.  

The Court found that the defendant is indigent and waived all costs and surcharges including the DNA surcharge and the DV surcharge.
Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copies given to defendant.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Sentencing.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Anthony James Lemieux not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. Parties have reached a resolution. 
AS TO COUNT 1
On a motion of the state pursuant to plea negotiations, the court ordered Count 1 Amended in to TWO COUNTS.
COUNT 1: Misdemeanor Intimidation of a Victim, Repeater, Domestic Abuse,  contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.44, 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(b) a class A misdemeanor.
COUNT 2: Misdemeanor Intimidation of a Victim, Repeater, Domestic Abuse,  contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.44, 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(b) a class A misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Anthony James Lemieux not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
JUDGE KUHNMUENCH FOR JUDGE GRADY IN BRANCH 23
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea Hearing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony James Lemieux in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Benjamin Lindsay for Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant in CUSTODY. 
JUDGE KONKOL FOR JUDGE GRADY IN BRANCH 23
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.G.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony James Lemieux in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Anthony James Lemieux in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised that due to a lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant advised the he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if certain conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
